definition: to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)

sentences.english: My kids think I am ATM.
sentences.chinese: 我孩子認爲我是提款機。

sentences.english: But they didn't realize that ATMs are bolted to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 但是他們沒有意識到，提款機是閂在地上的。

sentences.english: I need to hit an ATM.
The next day, Deborah took money out of the ATM.
sentences.chinese: 第二天Deborah從自動提款機取了錢出來。

sentences.english: There is an ATM machine nearby.
You can get money from our banking machine twenty-four hours a day.
sentences.chinese: 我們的提款機二十四小時爲你服務。

sentences.english: The overseas ATM and your debit card.
sentences.chinese: 考慮是否能在海外的提款機上使用你的銀行卡。

sentences.english: I don't like to take out more than fifty dollars at a time from a cash machine.
sentences.chinese: 我不想從銀行提款機一次提領超過五十元。

sentences.english: We are going to have to go to the automatic teller machine and draw money out to pay salaries by hand.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須去自動提款機上把錢取出來，手工發放工資。

sentences.english: Ben:Will we need to stop at a cash machine to get some money?
sentences.chinese: 我們要不要在提款機那兒取點現金備用？

sentences.english: She has to withdraw some money from the ATM.
sentences.chinese: 她得從自動提款機提領一些錢。

sentences.english: Is there an ATM(automated teller machine) with cash-advance function nearby?
sentences.chinese: 附近有無具預付款功能的自動提款機？

sentences.english: Oh my God, I am trapped in an ATM vestibule with Jill Goodacre!
sentences.chinese: 天啊，沒想到我和潔兒同時被困在提款機室？

sentences.english: Tear open the seal and key in your code at the ATM machine outside the bank.
sentences.chinese: 只要到銀行外的自動提款機把彌封拆開然後輸入密碼。

sentences.english: "We used house equity as an ATM, " Sherrill tells us.
sentences.chinese: “我們把房子當提款機用，”謝里爾告訴我們。

definition: to transfer (money to a bank account)
identity card/also written 身份證|身份证[shen1 fen4 zheng4]
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
to owe a debt/the sum owed
